messages.title: Competition is killing the NHS
messages.content: The message here promotes the public ownership of the NHS, criticizing the competition that the article claims is negatively affecting the healthcare system.

messages.title: The Green Party supports a living economy
messages.content: This section discusses the introduction of a living wage, investment in renewable energy, and community-focused banks as part of the Green Party's vision for a sustainable economy.

messages.title: Green energy powers ahead
messages.content: The leaflet describes the benefits of investing in renewable energy and the potential for job creation in this sector.

messages.title: How party funding can control politics
messages.content: This part of the leaflet raises concerns about political parties being funded by big businesses and wealthy individuals.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stop the privatization of our NHS, return to a fully publicly owned service.
Introduce a living wage, fix the banks, develop power from Westminster to communities, invest in renewable energies, and support community banks.
Scrap tuition fees, share the wealth.
Put people before profit, offer a citizens income.
Build council houses, proper deal for private renters.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet includes a pie chart showing the tactical voting considerations, where Green Party supporters could influence the majority in 'CRH Votes for Policies'.

issues.economy: Introduce a living wage, invest in renewable energy, and community-focused banks are mentioned under the economy.
issues.education: Scrap tuition fees is mentioned under education.
issues.environment: Investment in renewable energy is emphasized as a key policy point.
issues.health: The leaflet talks about stopping the privatization of the NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: Citizens income and putting people before profit are mentioned as part of social welfare policies.

housing.content: Build council houses, a proper deal for renters.

leaflet.personalStatement: Geoff has lived in Carharrack for nearly 30 years, and worked as a science teacher at Cornwall College in Camborne. Speaks about a Green political vision - a society of equality and mutual respect.

politicalExperience.achievements: Lifelong science teacher bringing knowledge and enthusiasm to the party's stance on the environment.

images.caption: The leaflet features images of Geoff Garbett, graphs illustrating poll positions, and graphics representing Green Party policies.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes a variety of informational content, such as a chart showing a poll of young people's voting intentions, emphasizing support for the Green Party.
